channel.title: CVE Feed for Mozilla -- Firefox ESR
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Mozilla -- Firefox ESR

item.title: CVE-2020-6828|2024-08-04T09:11:05.021Z -- mozilla -- firefox%20esr
item.description:
A malicious Android application could craft an Intent that would have been processed by Firefox for Android and potentially result in a file overwrite in the user's profile directory. One exploitation vector for this would be to supply a user.js file providing arbitrary malicious preference values. Control of arbitrary preferences can lead to sufficient compromise such that it is generally equivalent to arbitrary code execution.
*Note: This issue only affects Firefox for Android. Other operating systems are unaffected.*. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 68.7.

item.title: CVE-2020-6827|2024-08-04T09:11:05.149Z -- mozilla -- firefox%20esr
item.description:
When following a link that opened an intent://-schemed URL, causing a custom tab to be opened, Firefox for Android could be tricked into displaying the incorrect URI.
*Note: This issue only affects Firefox for Android. Other operating systems are unaffected.*. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 68.7.

item.title: CVE-2020-6831|2024-08-04T09:11:05.112Z -- mozilla -- firefox%20esr
item.description: A buffer overflow could occur when parsing and validating SCTP chunks in WebRTC. This could have led to memory corruption and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 68.8, Firefox < 76, and Thunderbird < 68.8.0.

item.title: CVE-2021-38493|2024-08-04T01:44:22.825Z -- mozilla -- firefox%20esr
item.description: Mozilla developers reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 91 and Firefox ESR 78.13. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.14, Thunderbird < 78.14, and Firefox < 92.

item.title: CVE-2024-2616|2024-07-05T17:21:11.755Z -- mozilla -- firefox%20esr
item.description: To harden ICU against exploitation, the behavior for out-of-memory conditions was changed to crash instead of attempt to continue. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 115.9 and Thunderbird < 115.9.

item.title: CVE-2024-2616|2024-03-19T12:02:58.997Z -- mozilla -- firefox%20esr
item.description: To harden ICU against exploitation, the behavior for out-of-memory conditions was changed to crash instead of attempt to continue. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 115.9 and Thunderbird < 115.9.

item.description: To harden ICU against exploitation, the behavior for out-of-memory conditions was changed to crash instead of attempt to continue. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 115.9 and Thunderbird < 115.9.
